import sys
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/config/python-code/')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/config/python-code/masks')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/usr/lib/')

import base64
import cv2
import time
import flir_image_extractor
import numpy as np

from anomalib.deploy import TorchInferencer

torch_model_path = os.environ["SNAP"] + "/config/models/semi-supervised-ad/battery_discharging/weights/torch/model.pt"
metadata_path = os.environ["SNAP"] + "/config/models/semi-supervised-ad/battery_discharging/weights/torch/metadata.json"

inferencer = TorchInferencer(
    path=torch_model_path,
    device="cpu",
)

imagePath = msg["fullPath"]

fir = flir_image_extractor.FlirImageExtractor()

fir.process_image(imagePath)
#img_raw = fir.get_thermal_image_cv()  # Get the thermal image in normalized np format
img_raw_np = fir.get_thermal_np_normalized()
img_raw_np = img_raw_np[:, :, :3]  # Keep only the first 3 channels (RGB)


# Convert BGR to RGB since OpenCV loads images in BGR format by default
img_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(img_raw_np, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB)

# Convert the ndarray to a byte array
_, img_encoded = cv2.imencode('.jpg', img_rgb)  # Use img_rgb here
img_bytes = img_encoded.tobytes()

# Encode the byte array to base64
img_base64 = base64.b64encode(img_bytes).decode('utf-8')

# Add the base64 string to the message
msg["img_raw_b64"] = img_base64

#msg["img_raw"] = img_raw_np

if img_raw_np is not None:
    # Perform inference
    
    # Assuming the image needs to be in the format required by the model
    predictions = inferencer.predict(image=img_raw_np)

    if predictions.pred_score > 0.90:
        msg["result"] = f'Anomaly! Pred. Score: {predictions.pred_score:.2f}'
        msg["anomaly"] = True
    else:
        msg["result"] = f'Normal. Pred. Score: {predictions.pred_score:.2f}'
        msg["anomaly"] = False

return msg

func:
import sys
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/config/python-code/')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/config/python-code/masks')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/')
sys.path.append('/snap/thermal-camera-diagnosis-app/x1/usr/lib/')

import base64
import cv2
import time
import flir_image_extractor
import numpy as np

from anomalib.deploy import TorchInferencer

torch_model_path = os.environ["SNAP"] + "/config/models/semi-supervised-ad/electric_kettle/padim/eKettleT/weights/torch/model.pt"

inferencer = TorchInferencer(
    path=torch_model_path,
    device="cpu",
)

imagePath = msg["fullPath"]

fir = flir_image_extractor.FlirImageExtractor()
fir.process_image(imagePath)

# Extract the normalized thermal image
img_raw_np = fir.get_thermal_np_normalized()

if img_raw_np is not None:
    # Keep only the first 3 channels (RGB)
    img_raw_np = img_raw_np[:, :, :3]

    # Convert BGR to RGB since OpenCV loads images in BGR format by default
    #img_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(img_raw_np, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB)

    # Convert the ndarray to a byte array
   # _, img_encoded = cv2.imencode('.jpg', img_rgb)
   # img_bytes = img_encoded.tobytes()

    # Encode the byte array to base64
   # img_base64 = base64.b64encode(img_bytes).decode('utf-8')

    # Add the base64 string to the message
    #msg["img_raw_b64"] = img_base64

    # Perform inference
    predictions = inferencer.predict(image=img_raw_np)

    if predictions.pred_score > 0.55:
        msg["result"] = f'Anomaly! Pred. Score: {predictions.pred_score:.2f}'
        msg["anomaly"] = True
    else:
        msg["result"] = f'Normal. Pred. Score: {predictions.pred_score:.2f}'
        msg["anomaly"] = False
else:
    msg["result"] = "Error: Could not process the thermal image."
    msg["anomaly"] = False

return msg
